title: Magnesium ion implantation enhances the osseointegration and vascularization of 3D-Printed CoCrMo alloy scaffolds for load-bearing orthopedic applications.
abstract: Total knee arthroplasty (TKA) remains the gold-standard treatment for end-stage osteoarthritis, yet persistent challenges in prosthetic material performance limit its long-term clinical efficacy. CoCrMo alloy is commonly used material of femoral component in TKA due to its excellent mechanical durability. However, two critical limitations persist: (1) substantial elastic modulus mismatch inducing stress-shielding effects, and (2) bioinert surface impairing osseointegration. To address these dual challenges, we developed a synergistic surface engineering strategy combining 3D-printed porous architecture with Mg
